body:
Thanks for making an issue about this.

It looks like the `cmount` tests are locking up on macOS sometimes both in the amd64 and the arm64 builds (which isn't suprising since they are both running the amd64 code when testing)

And if it does get through the `cmount` test, the build fails with

```
2022/01/26 10:47:04 Failed to run ["xcrun" "--sdk" "macosx11.1" "--show-sdk-path"]: exit status 1
```

I guess this is because something changed in the GitHub actions build environment...

I upgraded the build server to macos 11 and fix the SDK stuff. The builds are still locking up in the cmount tests, but I did managed to build an arm64 build

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5951-macos-build/v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build/rclone-v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build-osx-arm64.zip

Can you give that a quick test @l3v11 ? Does it run? Does `rclone mount` work?

I'll work more on the cmount lockup now ...

PS I don't have a mac of any flavour!
Ohh man, I don't have any mac too. Actually was seeing that issue while checking the Actions. So informed you :)

> I upgraded the build server to macos 11 and fix the SDK stuff. The builds are still locking up in the cmount tests, but I did managed to build an arm64 build
> 
> https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5951-macos-build/v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build/rclone-v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build-osx-arm64.zip
> 
> Can you give that a quick test @l3v11 ? Does it run? Does `rclone mount` work?

I have tried it
1. `./rclone ls` works fine
here's the output:
```bash
env38 ‚ùØ ./rclone ls phy57:/
     4096 cos1/4k
      703 hoyho/test.1
      116 hoyho/test.zip
```

2. rclone mount is requiring some other component
```bash
~/Desktop/rclone-v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build-osx-arm64
env38 ‚ùØ ./rclone mount phy57 mnt
2022/01/27 12:24:13 Fatal error: failed to mount FUSE fs: mount stopped before calling Init: mount failed: cgofuse: cannot find FUSE

~/Desktop/rclone-v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build-osx-arm64
env38 ‚ùØ ./rclone cmount phy57 mnt
2022/01/27 12:24:34 Fatal error: failed to mount FUSE fs: mount stopped before calling Init: mount failed: cgofuse: cannot find FUSE
```

Then I install macfuse via: `brew install macfuse`

Now It seems need more config:
```bash
env38 ‚ùØ ./rclone version
rclone v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build
- os/version: darwin 12.0.1 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 21.1.0 (arm64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: arm64
- go/version: go1.17.6
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: cmount

~/Desktop/rclone-v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build-osx-arm64
‚ùØ ./rclone mount phy57 mnt
mount_macfuse: the file system is not available (1)
2022/01/27 13:07:03 ERROR : Local file system at /Users/hoyho/Desktop/rclone-v1.58.0-beta.5963.e9d9d6904.fix-5951-macos-build-osx-arm64/phy57: Mount failed
2022/01/27 13:07:03 Fatal error: failed to mount FUSE fs: mount stopped before calling Init: mount failed
```

It looks like it is working...

This

```
./rclone mount phy57 mnt
```

Should be

```
./rclone mount phy57:/ mnt
```

Assuming that `mnt` is an empty existing directory.

If it doesn't work add `-vv` and post the output - thank you.

issue.title: macOS cmount tests on GitHub actions are locking up

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Any cmount related tests on GitHub actions are locking up.

I think this started when the macOS environment got updated.

Unfortunately no debug is printed so it is very difficult to debug.

For the time being the tests have been disabled on the CI in 83b6b62c1b0ec325bd037fd050385c864a551fb0

This issue was discovered in #5951

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
The builds are working again and you should find a working arm64 build in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in about 20 minutes from now :-)

The work on fixing the lockup with running the cmount tests is continuing in #5960
I would appreciate a quick test with mount on macOS with the beta just to make sure it is still working as we can no longer tell if the tests are locking up!

> I would appreciate a quick test with mount on macOS with the beta just to make sure it is still working as we can no longer tell if the tests are locking up!

Hi and thank you for this great project.
Mounting works on my side: 

```
xxx@xxx ~ % rclone --version
  rclone v1.58.0-beta.5984.b0de0b460
  - os/version: darwin 12.2 (64 bit)
  - os/kernel: 21.3.0 (arm64)
  - os/type: darwin
  - os/arch: arm64
  - go/version: go1.17.6
  - go/linking: dynamic
  - go/tags: cmount
xxx@xxx ~ % rclone mount onedrive .Volumes/onedrive
2022/02/03 06:56:02 NOTICE: One drive root '': --vfs-cache-mode writes or full is recommended for this remote as it can't stream
xxx@xxx ~ % ls .Volumes/onedrive
```

Shows some files ! 

Other info: 
- MacOS version:

`xxx@xxx ~ % sw_vers
ProductName:	macOS
ProductVersion:	12.2
BuildVersion:	21D49`

- Macfuse version: 4.2.4
